reviewText: BLACK! And you wanna know why I know that random bit of trivia? Because it was a featured on a radio contest episode of Salute Your Shorts!, one of my favorite TV shows ever. I just saw Rilo Kiley last Monday (an amazing band, by the way) and for those of you who don't know, Blake Sennett who played "Pinsky" (the kid who replaced Michael after he myseriously left the series) plays lead guitar along side the beautiful Jenny Lewis. In any case, seeing him reminded me how much I loved the show and how badly I wish they would release it on DVD. Pete & Pete is a good start, but please, Nickelodeon, make this your next release. Thanks.
summary: What color is a giraffe's tongue?

reviewText: I recently purchased this item on Ebay, and although I am extremely happy to finally have this DVD series.. I want to have the real thing!!  I don't think the network understands the fanbase, and how much money they would make if they sold this on DVD.  The shows out now for this generation are jack squat compared to what my generation had.  I want to be able to watch this in good quality whenever I can, and also give it to my cousins who have crap to watch now!Please put this out on DVD ASAP!!!

reviewText: This was one of my favorite television shows as a child.  I could connect and sympathize with the characters in a way that today's children probably can't identify with their television icons.  The themes center around learning how to get along with each other and how to deal with life.  How many kids' shows today will actually touch on the topic of divorce, let alone a child dealing with their single parent's love interests?  How many shows depict children being children, rather than mini-adults worrying about if so-and-so is interested in them?  I haven't seen any since the 90s, and I am dying to see this show on DVD.
summary: A Wonderful Show with Kids being Kids!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This ISNT Joseph. This is his oldest daughter.I AM SO HAPPY THAT THEY ARE PUTTING THIS SHOW ON DVD!!! 90'S NICK ROCKS!!!! Salute your shorts has plenty of laughs with morals and lessons along the way. The red haired boy was my favorite character (the name hasn't come back to me yet). He was always coming up with something hilarious. He MADE the show.Frankly, Nickelodeon has become really retarded. The 90s nickelodeon was SO MUCH BETTER because it contained shows like "My Brother and Me", "Clarissa Explains It All", "All That" (the one with kenan and kel. not the new RETARDED ONE), "Kenan and Kel" and of course, "Pete and Pete".Slaute your shorts is very funny show that stuck to our hearts like glue. Not like the dumb stuff that is on nickelodeon today. Take my advice and buy this DVD when it is released. Then you'll see why Nickelodeon has "gone to the dogs" without this and other ninties favorites on it.P.S. Nickelodeon if you read this: PUT MY BROTHER AND ME ON DVD!!!!!!

reviewText: Old Nickelodeon was the best thing that ever hit TV.  Of course life has to move on, but I really wish they had a channel that would play episodes from old nickelodeon.  This series is very funny and adventuresome.  The beginning song will stay in your head forever and I feel myself to always having to say "It's I hope we never part, now get it right or pay the price".  Anyways, shows like this are very good and if you grew up in the 90's you will love them.

reviewText: The shows that they have on nickelodeon are so stupid now. I swear someone needs to write a letter to nickelodeon and tell them to put there 90's shows back on, because they were soooooo much better. I mean come on! what the fudge happended to "Nick in the afternoon" with stick stickly? what the fudge happened to Are you affraid of the dark?! I loved that show with a passion! And they have the nerve to take it off tv! But most of all why did they take "salute your shorts" off!? Come on nickelodeon stop riding the short bus and put all of the good shows back on nickelodeon, can't you possibly see that 90's nickelodeon had the best tv shows ever. And at least release some of the shows out on dvd. There are little or none of them out there. Nickelodeon are you listening to what your fans want?!
summary: Nickelodeon? It should now be be changed to Sh*telodeon!

reviewText: Memories, so many memories. I remember watching the show and others on Nick back in the 90's. This was my favorite even watched the marathon when aired. If only I recorded it, instead of possibly paying an arm & leg or buying the bootleg versions off Ebay. Hell, I even wanted to go to summer camp thinking it will be like the show. Poor Ug. lol I hope the dvd/vhs version be release so those who cherished the good shows back then can re-live the good ole 90's. Nothing against the shows nows, just not the same quality, to me, of course.

reviewText: There are so many of us out there who are in our early to mid-20s who remember this show and loved to watch it. Having said that, I don't understand why they won't go ahead a release it? People will buy it. No question about that."Salute Your Shorts" was one of my favorite 90s Nick shows along with "The Adventures of Pete and Pete" and "Are You Afraid of the Dark?" I also loved some of the real early 90s and late 80s shows on Nick like "Welcome Freshmen." I wish they would also release "You Can't Do That On Television," which was a classic and "Out of Control," which featured a young Dave Colier before he sold his soul to ABC's "Full House." What was that loser thinking?Anyway, please Nickelodeon release these shows on DVD and more importantly make "Salute Your Shorts" on your top priorites!
summary: Why Won't They Release This Show On DVD?
